thread.title: These Consumer Stocks Got A Boost From Wall Street Upgrades

title: These Consumer Stocks Got A Boost From Wall Street Upgrades
text:
Homebuilders Lead, Chips Lag; Distribution For S&P 500 
The S&P 500 suffered another mild distribution day Tuesday, and semiconductor stocks weighed on the Nasdaq. But it wasn't all bad for the broad market despite another sell-off in China stocks overnight. The Nasdaq fell 0.6%, the S&P 500 eased 0.3%, and the Dow gave up 0.2%. Ironically, selling ... 08/18/2015 07:06 PM ET Disney, Fox Downgraded: Is It The Netflix Effect? 
Wells Fargo downgraded several media stocks on Tuesday — including Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS), CBS (NYSE:CBS) and 21st Century Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) — citing the dismal earnings season within the group during the second quarter. The downgrade comes a couple of weeks after media stocks got ... 08/18/2015 04:27 PM ET Stocks Down, Try For Late Comeback; Paycom Back Near Buy Point 
The decline in major stock averages worsened, but they came slightly off their session lows late Tuesday. The Nasdaq pared a 0.7% loss to 0.5% and the S&P 500 trimmed a 0.4% deficit to 0.2%. Meanwhile, the Dow Jones industrial average continued to fare better with a 0.1% loss. Gains in Home ... 08/18/2015 03:05 PM ET Apple Web TV: How many cable channels will make the cut? 
What cable channels make the cut and are included in Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) expected Web TV service could take on more significance after the recent sell-off in media and entertainment stocks. Apple, it's widely reported, has been in talks with programmers to offer a slimmed-down bundle of TV ... 08/18/2015 01:42 PM ET Facebook, EBay, Google Flex Renewed Tech Strength 
This week's list of leading big-cap issues features emerging strength in technology, some long-time biotech leaders that are holding up well and some food and beverage plays. From the biotech field, Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) is building a new flat base with 123.47 buy point. Gilead shares are ... 08/17/2015 06:30 PM ET Homebuilders Rally On Bullish Survey 
The housing market is back. A closely watched sentiment index from the National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) hit a high not seen since the heady days of the housing bubble. Homebuilders D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) and LGI Homes (NASDAQ:LGIH) hit new highs, as did home improvement giant Home Depot ... 08/17/2015 06:30 PM ET Restoration Hardware Debuts Its RH Teen Line 
Restoration Hardware's new collection for teenagers could become a furniture hotspot among the upper crust, says one analyst. The high-end furniture and home decor brand announced late Thursday the rollout of RH Teen, "designed to fill the current void in the market for tasteful, high quality ... 08/14/2015 05:19 PM ET 5 Hot Refiners Hit New Highs On Expanding Margins 
The oil and gas refining industry group has been climbing the ranks this year and is now at No. 51, up from 144 six months ago. Three stocks in the group earn 90 or better Composite Ratings, with four more above 85. In this group, Valero Energy (NYSE:VLO), Tesoro (NYSE:TSO), HollyFrontier ... 08/13/2015 05:54 PM ET Skechers, Nike Top No. 1 Apparel Sector 
Apparel stocks are riding high in the thick of back-to-school shopping season. The sector ranked No. 1, while two subgroups — shoes and clothing manufacturers — ranked Nos. 1 and 23, respectively, among the 197 industry groups in Wednesday's IBD. Past the midway point of 2015, the S&P 500 is clinging to just a small gain. Trading has been choppy and lacking sustained rallies, but some segments of the market have still managed to thrive. Among IBD's 197 industry groups, 18 are up 20% or more year to date. Strength has been concentrated ... 08/11/2015 06:23 PM ET
